ca.mcgill.ecse211.finalproject

Class UltrasonicLocalizer

  • java.lang.Object
    • ca.mcgill.ecse211.finalproject.UltrasonicLocalizer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable

    public class UltrasonicLocalizer
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Runnable
    Thread which is responsible for using the US sensor and the wall rammer to localize in the beginning of the competition
    Author:
    yp

      states when going through localization

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      private static void backOffFromYWall()
      the robot backs away from the wall for 5 cm and turns counter-clock-wise to face the x-axis wall.
      private static void detectYWall()
      the method for that the robot takes to detect the y-axis wall.
      private static void finishing()
      the robot back up from the x-axis wall and turns clock-wise 180 degrees.
      private static void gazeTheAbyss()
      method for when the robot is pointing away from the wall, it continues to turn until it encounters a wall, at which point it slows down
      private static void init()
      method for the initial state, the robot turns until the reading of higher than 5 tiles away is detected, at whcih point we know that the robot is pointing away from the wall
      private static void ramXWall()
      the robot drive forward for about 7.5 seconds to ram the x-axis wall.
      private static void ramYWall()
      The robot is pointing towards to y-axis wall and drives forward for about 5 seconds, the two protruding rammers will heklp the robot to align itself
      private static void rotateCounterClockWiseNonBLocking()
      rotate counter clock wise
      void run() 
      private static void setSpeed(int speed)
      set Speed
      private static void stopTheRobot()
      Stop the robot

    • Method Detail

      • run

        public void run()
        Specified by:
        run in interface java.lang.Runnable

      • init

        private static void init()
        method for the initial state, the robot turns until the reading of higher than 5 tiles away is detected, at whcih point we know that the robot is pointing away from the wall

      • gazeTheAbyss

        private static void gazeTheAbyss()
        method for when the robot is pointing away from the wall, it continues to turn until it encounters a wall, at which point it slows down

      • detectYWall

        private static void detectYWall()
        the method for that the robot takes to detect the y-axis wall. the robot turns very slowly until there is an increase to the reading, at which point we know that the robot is relatively perpendicular to the y-axis wall

      • ramYWall

        private static void ramYWall()
        The robot is pointing towards to y-axis wall and drives forward for about 5 seconds, the two protruding rammers will heklp the robot to align itself

      • backOffFromYWall

        private static void backOffFromYWall()
        the robot backs away from the wall for 5 cm and turns counter-clock-wise to face the x-axis wall.

      • ramXWall

        private static void ramXWall()
        the robot drive forward for about 7.5 seconds to ram the x-axis wall. again the protruding rammers will help the robot to align with x-wall

      • finishing

        private static void finishing()
        the robot back up from the x-axis wall and turns clock-wise 180 degrees. After this statge the robot will be at the center of the square and facing exactly 0 degrees

      • stopTheRobot

        private static void stopTheRobot()
        Stop the robot

      • setSpeed

        private static void setSpeed(int speed)
        set Speed

      • rotateCounterClockWiseNonBLocking

        private static void rotateCounterClockWiseNonBLocking()
        rotate counter clock wise
